item.title: Update your ABC News homepage for more local stories
item.description: We've got an ABC News homepage for you. Adjust your settings for the right mix of local and national news.

item.title: Call for button battery redesign after new study reveals horrific injuries and fatalities
item.description: A new study reveals the horrific injuries suffered after swallowing or inserting button batteries but manufacturers aren't prioritising their redesign.

item.title: The US election is about style more than substance. It's why Kamala Harris needs to nail her DNC speech in about eight seconds
item.description: When the Democrat presidential candidate Kamala Harris delivers her speech to the Democratic National Convention today, style will be almost everything.

item.title: Reserve Bank restructure closer to reality after Treasurer Jim Chalmers offers olive branch to Angus Taylor
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia is a step closer to its biggest restructure in three decades after the treasurer offers an assurance to his Coalition counterpart.

item.title: Have Your Say: What was the issue, policy or event that decided your vote?
item.description: After a five-week campaign, the results are in with Labor returned to government. Is there a policy or issue that swayed your vote? Have Your Say.

item.title: Voters tell ABC's Your Say they want politicians with a vision, not bickering
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they want courage and vision from politicians, not bickering.

item.title: Push for seniors' dental scheme grows ahead of federal election
item.description: Imagine living in aged care and not having your teeth or dentures properly cleaned and checked each day. That's a risk faced by elderly Australians, prompting calls for the next federal government to boost oral health training and services.

item.title: Australians tell ABC's Your Say they are struggling more than ever with housing costs
item.description: Voters tell ABC's Your Say campaign they are struggling more than ever with housing costs.

item.title: Australia's growing cohort of tenants fear they will rent forever
item.description: Home ownership rates in Australia have been falling for decades, and with rental vacancies at record lows and prices at historic highs, many fear their dream of owning a home may be out of reach. Some experts say rental caps could help.

item.title: Graduates in 'debt vortex' as HECS front and centre for first time in an election
item.description: New research shows a sharp rise in HECS debts, despite graduate earning power declining, as student loans become a potent election issue for the first time.

item.title: Housing advocates seek federal funding election promise for co-op model
item.description: Advocates admit co-operative housing models are not for everyone but say for the right residents, they offer more security and affordable pricing than traditional rentals.

item.title: Next-generation voters call for better engagement ahead of federal election
item.description: Young people in Albury say issues that directly affect them and their communities are not being addressed by major parties for the 2025 election campaign.

item.title: Melbourne seat of Calwell highlights Labor woes as Gaza pain galvanises Muslim voters
item.description: Dissatisfaction with the Albanese government's stance on Israel-Palestine among many Arab and Muslim voters threatens to unseat Labor MPs, in some places for the first time.

item.title: Cost of living, housing among key concerns in SA marginal seat of Boothby
item.description: At this year’s federal election, the South Australian seat of Boothby is one of the state’s two marginal seats. As part of the ABC’s “Your Say” campaign, we spoke to residents in the electorate about their biggest concerns.

item.title: Energy projects in South West WA threaten votes for major federal parties
item.description: Australia's two major parties have tied their federal election fates to controversial energy projects in WA's South West where the issues have polarised voters.

item.title: Tiwi Islanders eager to have their say as remote voting for the federal election begins
item.description: Voters in the small remote community of Pirlangimpi on the Tiwi Islands, north of Darwin, have become some of the first to cast their votes for the federal election.

item.title: Mobile coverage is an election issue in regional areas. What's been promised?
item.description: For many regional and remote Australians, reliable mobile coverage can be life-saving. They are desperate for both sides of politics to take meaningful action towards eliminating black spots.

item.title: Health, climate and community sport: What older voters in the Tasmanian seat of Bass are talking about this election
item.description: The federal seat of Bass is held by a margin of just 1.4 per cent. For these older voters who live in the electorate, health, climate and community sport are the issues that will decide their vote.

item.title: Video record of violence and racism at Purnim Bears, Noorat country football grand final
item.description: The Purnim Bears were supposed to be the feel-good story of country football — a team uniting black and white communities. But their 1987 grand final was so violent it ended with their expulsion.

item.title: Moment Brisbane Lions win 2025 AFL premiership
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Melbourne Storm and Brisbane Broncos face off in NRL Grand Final
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Former WA Health boss outlines missing pieces of puzzle
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Calls to ban machetes as elderly Territorians terrorised in their own homes
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Broncos shares surge 40 per cent after Grand Final win
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Powerlifting champion aged 82 and ready to represent Australia
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Bridget Archer announces funding for Hobart Clinic
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dying mother loses life insurance after failing to declare UTI tests
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: The deep Indigenous history of Australia deserves to be up in lights
item.description: We've flipped the script to put Indigenous Australians back at the centre of telling their own stories.

item.title: How much do you really know about Australia's epic 65,000-year history?
item.description: First Nations people have survived and thrived through an ice age and massive landscape changes — as well as sharing the land with giant animals.

item.title: Why are Queensland councils voting to remove fluoride from their water?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: How worried should we be about microplastics in our homes?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: 'Localised extinction' risk for seagrass in Botany Bay
item.description: It is estimated half of the local seagrass habitat in Gamay (Botany Bay) has already been lost. Researchers and Aboriginal rangers are replanting seagrass fragments and using biochar to restore the area.

item.title: Our country's 50,000-year-old encyclopedia
item.description: There are more than 2 million artworks on the rocks at Murujuga, with more stories under the waves.

item.title: Bon Jovi meets Australia's national rugby league team
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Ms Dean goes camping and 4WDing after years of rehab.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Australians with oral cancer helped by 3D printing
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Dr Richard Scolyer speaks on his fight with brain cancer
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Stripped of his titles and his home, Andrew's humiliation is complete
item.description: Once considered the darling of the royal family and the "favourite" son of Queen Elizabeth II, the king's brother will now be known only as Andrew Mountbatten Windsor. It's a humiliation for the history books.

item.title: Canberra will get its first dementia care village
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: When is the RBA meeting next? When will interest rates go down?
item.description: Many people paying off mortgages were hoping for a cash rate cut, but recent inflation data means that is highly unlikely.

item.title: Horse racing replays edited to remove falls and deaths as industry grapples with social licence
item.description: For years, the racing industry has been quietly removing falls and deaths from its replays. Now, industry insiders are speaking out.

item.title: House prices have been climbing for a generation. Undoing the damage could take even longer
item.description: It's an inconvenient truth that a housing crisis that took a generation to create cannot be fixed easily. The damage will likely take another generation to undo, unless the solution comes at the expense of those who already own their homes.

item.title: From England to Flemington — 20 years on from Makybe Diva's third Melbourne Cup victory
item.description: From quiet beginnings, an unknown English filly came Down Under and changed Australia's racing history by achieving the impossible. This is how Makybe Diva won a historic third Melbourne Cup 20 years ago.

item.title: Half Yours wins $10 million Melbourne Cup at Flemington, beating Goodie Two Shoes and Middle Earth
item.description: Half Yours wins the 165th edition of the Melbourne Cup at Flemington, with jockey Jamie Melham making history as the first female jockey to win both the Melbourne and Caulfield Cups.

item.title: PNG hospital says anyone prepared to take on conjoined twins 'must be willing to take on' the risks
item.description: The mother of a rare set of conjoined twins is begging doctors to explore other options after a Papua New Guinea hospital recommended against sending the infants overseas for surgery.

item.title: Millions are going unpaid and hungry as the US federal government shutdown breaks records
item.description: The ongoing federal government shutdown has surpassed the record for the longest in US history, leaving thousands of workers without pay. Here are some of the key numbers.

item.title: Sena needed surgery, but she couldn't understand her doctors
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: These charts show the effect of migration on Australia's housing story
item.description: The role of migration is one of the most contentious elements to the housing debate. So what does the evidence show?

item.title: How Elon Musk lined up a potential trillion-dollar payday as Tesla shareholders approve deal
item.description: Shareholders at Tesla's Texas factory chanted "Elon, Elon" as they overwhelmingly approved the largest-ever CEO compensation package for the company's controversial boss.

item.title: How colourism and social media abuse have roiled Pacific beauty pageants
item.description: Beauty pageants remain serious business in the Pacific, but contestants are thinking twice before entering due to online bullying and discrimination.

item.title: Aryna Sabalenka to face Elena Rybakina in WTA Finals title decider
item.description: World number one Aryna Sabalenka books a showdown with Elena Rybakina, with both players eyeing off their first season-ending championship win.

item.title: Wallabies fall to Italy 26-19 in Udine Test to record consecutive defeats
item.description: The Wallabies slump to consecutive defeats on their spring tour, as Italy comes from behind to win in Udine.

item.title: How the dismissal of Gough Whitlam's Labor government in 1975 was sealed by the Senate
item.description: Before Gough Whitlam's dismissal and famous speech on the steps of Parliament House, there was silence — and strategy — in the Senate. This is the inside story of how a budget stand-off changed Australian democracy forever.

item.title: Samoan fans line the streets of Apia ahead of match against New Zealand
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Pacific, pride, and pancakes with Papa's father-in-law
item.description: The passion of the Pacific shines through in Samoa's rugby league team, and the pride the people have is evident on the island.

item.title: Elena Rybakina defeats Aryna Sabalenka to win WTA Finals and collect record prize money
item.description: Elena Rybakina has defeated world number one Aryna Sabalenka to win the season-ending WTA Finals, 6-3, 7-6(0).

item.title: Women's pain inquiry finds Victorians' suffering worsened by male-centred healthcare system
item.description: A Victorian inquiry has found a dismissive and disrespectful healthcare system centred around men is contributing to poorer outcomes for women and girls.

item.title: Wallabies lament poor performance in 26-19 Test rugby loss to Italy
item.description: Wallabies captain Harry Wilson says he is "hurting" after Australia's 26-19 loss to Italy, while coach Joe Schmidt is lamenting his side's "flat performance".

item.title: Feelings of failure and being unseen. What it's like to be a stepmum
item.description: There is no road map for step-parenting, and experts say a common mistake is assuming it will be easy.

item.title: AFLW finals: Brisbane Lions beat Melbourne by 13 points to reach prelim final, Adelaide beats St Kilda
item.description: Brisbane defeats Melbourne for the first time in AFLW finals, as the Lions win on the road to clinch a preliminary final spot, and Adelaide ends St Kilda's season.

item.title: Cook Islands qualify for Rugby League World Cup, beating South Africa 58-6 in Sydney
item.description: Cook Islands book their spot in a fourth Rugby League World Cup, turning it on to beat South Africa 58-6 in Sydney.

item.title: New Zealand defeats Samoa 36-14 to claim Pacific Cup and farewell Kieran Foran in style
item.description: New Zealand overturns an eight-point half-time deficit to defeat Samoa 36-14 and claim its second Pacific Cup.

item.title: Why the Pacific Championship final should be a look into rugby league's future
item.description: New Zealand stopped Samoa from making history in the Pacific Championship final but the match was a tantalising reminder of what's possible for rugby league in the days to come.

item.title: From jackaroo to 'Golden Tonsils' radio titan: the life and career of John Laws
item.description: John Laws, also known as "Golden Tonsils", spent a mammoth 71 years on air at stations such as Sydney's 2UE and 2SM, before retiring in November 2024.

item.title: Alex de Minaur defeated in ATP Finals by Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(5), 6-2
item.description: Top seed Carlos Alcaraz began his bid for a first ATP Finals trophy with a 7-6(5), 6-2 win over Australian Alex de Minaur in their round-robin clash at the season-ending championships in Turin on Sunday.

item.title: Crime rise at Melbourne shopping centres sparks calls for action
item.description: Crime has increased at several major Melbourne shopping centres with concerned communities calling for more action.

item.title: Time running out for Australia to win the rights to host COP31 in Adelaide
item.description: It is almost crunch time for Australia to secure hosting rights for the next COP meeting, so it is timely to examine why the government's bid is languishing and how it can resolve a long-running stand-off with Türkiye.

item.title: AFL gives teams finishing 10th chance to win premiership through wildcard round in finals
item.description: AFL teams ranked ninth and 10th will be in contention to win the premiership from next season, with the league introducing a wildcard round.

item.title: Respected engineer sounds alarm on extent of defective Darwin apartment buildings
item.description: A respected consulting engineer says about 80 per cent of apartment buildings he has inspected in Darwin have serious structural issues.

item.title: Wallabies 'not looking for excuses' after defeat to Italy
item.description: Wallabies coach Joe Schmidt says his weary charges must toughen up rather than seek excuses after falling to Italy in Udine, ahead of two more severe tests to come.

item.title: Why Oscar Piastri was handed a 10-second penalty during the F1 São Paulo Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri was involved in the biggest flashpoint of the Formula 1 São Paulo Grand Prix, earning him a costly penalty and damaging his chances of winning the drivers' championship.

item.title: More than 2,800 US flights cancelled in a day as government shutdown persists
item.description: More than 2,800 domestic flights are cancelled in the United States over the course of a single day due to an ongoing shortage of air traffic controllers.

item.title: US Senate votes in favour of bill to end federal government shutdown
item.description: The US Senate votes in favour of ending the longest government shutdown in the country's history, which has lasted for 40 days.

item.title: The AFL's Wildcard Round has been met with negative reviews, so why does it exist?
item.description: Footy fans are not impressed with the AFL's new finals-extending Wildcard Round, but it is all part of Andrew Dillon's grand plan for total domination of Australian sport.

item.title: Lions are 'unrelenting' and yet again the underdogs for this finals series
item.description: The Brisbane Lions secured a spot in their sixth consecutive preliminary with a win over Melbourne on the weekend. Yet with North Melbourne's dominance, the Queenslanders are "underdogs" in the race for the flag once again.

item.title: Thinking about an e-bike or e-scooter for your kid? Here's what's legal and safe
item.description: E-bikes and e-scooters might sound like an exciting gift for a teenager or child, but experts say there are several things to consider before buying one.

item.title: Measles warning issued for South West and Great Southern as confirmed case numbers climb
item.description: Authorities and experts urge people in the state's south to be on alert for measles as the number of community transmission cases continues to climb.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue 'corrupt' BBC for $1.5b over 'salacious' documentary
item.description: Lawyers for the US president warn Britain's national broadcaster they are preparing to sue it over "fabricated" statements that aired in its Panorama program last year.

item.title: The faces with a front-row seat to history
item.description: After Gough Whitlam was sacked, a crowd formed. They could have stormed the building. Fifty years on, this photo tells the story of The Dismissal.

item.title: Why Australia's ironclad future is under threat
item.description: For decades, China has resented being held hostage over the iron ore price by its own insatiable demand and a handful of Australian producers.

item.title: Cardiac patient reveals urgent surgery at Sydney public hospital was cancelled four times
item.description: Ian Parker waited more than three months for urgent heart surgery that should have been done within 30 days. He was inspired to share his story after an ABC investigation.

item.title: Stunning icicle kick by David Rodríguez wins Canadian Premier League final
item.description: A blizzard, a sensational overhead kick goal, snowploughs clearing the pitch for extra time — the Canadian Premier League soccer final had it all.

item.title: Whitlam Dismissal live from 1975: How it unfolded, 50 years on
item.description: Fifty years ago today, prime minister Gough Whitlam was dismissed by governor-general Sir John Kerr. To mark the anniversary, we're putting you right there as it happened, covering the key moments of that fateful day in 1975 in real time.

item.title: Wallabies desperate to avoid 67-year low on draining end of season Tour of Europe
item.description: After falling to England and Italy, the Wallabies are halfway towards becoming the first Australian tourists since 1958 to lose four straight Tests in Europe.

item.title: Te Maire Martin ready to aid Eli Katoa's recovery, but warns path may not be comparable
item.description: Te Maire Martin knows what it takes to get back on the field after a brain bleed, but warns that Eli Katoa's path is not going to be exactly identical for one reason.

item.title: A motorised hydrofoiler rides well clear of swimmers off Adelaide's metropolitan coastline
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Non-bank sector in ASIC, RBA's gaze as customers chasing property loans drift their way
item.description: The tapering of super-sized bank profits has shone a spotlight on the growth of the non-bank sector. Regulators have them in sight given the risk they pose to the financial system.

item.title: Nauruan president makes secretive trip to parliament amid claims bikies won lucrative contract
item.description: Nauru's president has made a secretive visit to Parliament House in Canberra amid allegations that bikie gangs won a lucrative contract to provide security for former immigration detainees.

item.title: I thought I hated basketball. Now it's given me an amazing life
item.description: After breaking her back at 19 Katherine's community made sure she knew how special she was. Wheelchair basketball brought her back to earth and made her life "truly amazing".

item.title: Tuesday finance with Daniel Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Nationals nominate hardliner for net zero talks as Liberals meet to settle position
item.description: One of the Nationals' most strident opponents of net zero will attend talks on a final Coalition policy position. Before then, the Liberals must decide their own stance — but conservatives are now confident net zero will be dropped.

item.title: Sussan Ley sees the Coalition's young voter problem but may not survive to offer solutions
item.description: The Coalition risks political extinction unless it can reconnect with younger voters who have abandoned it in droves.

item.title: Are 5 per cent deposits the leg-up first home buyers need, or are they pouring fuel on the fire?
item.description: It will be some time before the full effects of the government's expanded first home buyer support scheme become clear, but young Australians across the country say it is still a tough market.

item.title: Michelle Foster's family feels let down by mental health and justice systems
item.description: Andrea Foster and her son Peter Spiniello continue to feel let down by a system they believe caused the death of their daughter, and sister, who was killed seven years ago by a mentally unwell man.

item.title: Doctors defend emergency department triage policy as 'closing the gap in action'
item.description: Doctors and medical associations have backed a Melbourne hospital's emergency department triage policy to improve care for First Nations patients, describing criticisms of the closing the gap measure as 'opportunistic, uninformed'.

item.title: Black Friday sales set to be biggest on record with shoppers spending billions on deals
item.description: About 6 million Australians are expected to take part in Black Friday sales this year and on average they will fork out $804 each.

item.title: Leo relies on exercise physiology to keep him moving but that could change under NDIS review
item.description: Leo depends on exercise physiology to keep him moving, but there are fears that his progress could be halted under an NDIS review.

item.title: Genea patients want IVF giant held to account as cybersecurity expert raises ongoing concerns
item.description: Patients of fertility giant Genea want the company held to account for a data breach earlier this year, amid concerns that some of its IT systems continue to fall short of best practice.

item.title: Aboriginal team wins national award for suicide prevention work in Alice Springs
item.description: The Alice Springs team has been rewarded for its culture of listening to reduce high suicide rates in the Northern Territory.

item.title: Vapes reaching country towns across WA despite strengthened laws
item.description: Despite a federal crackdown, shops selling vapes are popping up in regional areas prompting increased calls for education programs in schools.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo confirms 2026 World Cup will be his last with retirement looming
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo says the 2026 World Cup will be his last as he plots retirement in the next two years.

item.title: Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in 'urgent' pre-Christmas 2028 campaign fundraising drive
item.description: Northern Territory senator Jacinta Nampijinpa Price is asking supporters to dig deep ahead of the festive season and help bankroll a $125,000 campaign fund three years out from the 2028 federal election.

item.title: Alex de Minaur beaten by Lorenzo Musetti but still alive at ATP Finals
item.description: Alex de Minaur's hopes of reaching the ATP Finals semis hang by a thread after a heartbreaking three-set loss to Lorenzo Musetti.

item.title: Spy chief warns of China espionage threat to business, critical infrastructure
item.description: ASIO director-general Mike Burgess urges businesses to protect their data to prepare for possible attacks from hostile states.

item.title: Sam Kerr scores twice in first club start in 692 days as Chelsea defeat St. Pölten 6-0 in the Women's Champions League
item.description: Sam Kerr celebrates her first Chelsea start in almost two years by scoring a double, then declaring herself 100 per cent fit and "ready to go" for more game time and goals.

item.title: Can we tackle climate change without net zero? Here's what it really means
item.description: The Liberal shadow ministry has agreed to dump net zero by 2050 from the party’s platform. Here's what that term actually means.

item.title: Japanese ambassador calls for security 'triangle' with Australia, US
item.description: Japan's ambassador to Australia calls for the two countries to form an "equilateral" security triangle with the United States, while championing the role of gas in the clean energy transition.

item.title: Not introverted or extroverted? You could be an otrovert
item.description: Unlike extroverts or introverts, otroverts don't look outward or retreat inward to be energised.

item.title: Ben Stokes calls out 'has-beens' after criticism of England's Ashes preparations
item.description: Critics of England's truncated preparation for this summer's Ashes Test series are off the mark, according to touring captain Ben Stokes.

item.title: National mental health agreement failing, Productivity Commission finds
item.description: A scathing Productivity Commission review concludes that Australia's mental health system is failing and needs a rewrite, while warning that 500,000 Australians are unable to access the care that they need.

item.title: Australia and Indonesia strike landmark security treaty
item.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese declares a "new era" in the relationship between the neighbours in a joint appearance with Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto in Sydney.

item.title: Melbourne Cup-winning jockey Jamie Melham suspended for 30 race meetings for careless riding
item.description: History-making jockey Jamie Melham has hit the headlines for the wrong reasons, with the Melbourne Cup winner banned for 30 race meetings for careless riding that resulted in a race fall for Blake Shinn.

item.title: Two-thirds of A-League Women players experience 'psychological distress', PFA report finds
item.description: More than two-thirds of A-League Women players were in psychological distress last season, including experiencing disordered eating, alcohol misuse or disturbed sleep, according to football's players' union.

item.title: Man found not criminally responsible for murder of Ray McCormack in Wollongong
item.description: Train station rough sleeper Aaron Michael Lord has been found not criminally responsible for the murder of Ray McCormack in a Wollongong stairwell.

item.title: Queensland Health issues alert after three measles cases attend Jelly Roll concert at Brisbane Entertainment Centre
item.description: Queensland Health says the three infected people were at last month's concert of American singer Jelly Roll at the Brisbane Entertainment Centre and is warning others who attended to be alert for symptoms.

item.title: Four key takeaways from the Eddie Murphy documentary Being Eddie
item.description: Eddie Murphy has taken on many characters throughout his career, sometimes even within the same film. But a new documentary explores the "real Eddie Murphy" — someone the actor and comedian says few people actually know.

item.title: Queensland Health warns hospitals to strengthen procedures around medical imaging results
item.description: Authorities fear some patients involved in a medical imaging bungle have suffered long-term or permanent harm due to delays in receiving scan results and follow-up care.

item.title: Ley to announce final position on net zero after Liberals clear path to dump target
item.description: Months of bitter infighting between Liberals over the party's climate policy could be drawing to a close, with MPs paving the way for net zero to be formally abandoned at a shadow ministry meeting on Thursday.

item.title: Abortion legislation voted down in South Australian Parliament
item.description: A new push to change South Australia's abortion laws to limit terminations after 23 weeks has been voted down in state parliament's Upper House.

item.title: Woolworths executive was hospitalised by 100-hour-a-week workload, lawsuit claims
item.description: The executive had a suspected stroke, went temporarily blind and was hospitalised five times after regularly clocking more than 100 hours a week on the job, according to documents filed with the Federal Court.

item.title: Alleged Myanmar scam kingpin She Zhijiang extradited to China from Thailand
item.description: The US has accused She Zhijiang of turning a village on the Thailand-Myanmar border into a resort city "custom-built for gambling, drug trafficking, prostitution, and scams targeting people around the world".

item.title: Ukraine suspends justice minister amid corruption probe involving top figures close to Zelenskyy
item.description: After his suspension from the post of justice minister, German Galushchenko said in a Facebook post that he would defend himself in court.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein emails suggest Donald Trump knew about his sexual abuse
item.description: Donald Trump has denied any involvement in or knowledge of the sex-trafficking activities of his former friend, and the White House has accused Democrats of peddling a "fake narrative".

item.title: Cambodia and Thailand accuse each other of border violence amid reports of civilian casualties
item.description: Phnom Penh has accused Thai troops of killing a civilian at the border, just days after a peace deal between the two countries was paused by Thailand.

item.title: UK prime minister Keir Starmer insists team 'united' as rumours swirl of leadership challenge
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer is denying he authorised unnamed allies to brief the media about a possible leadership challenge, in a move that forced his health minister to publicly deny he was plotting against him.

item.title: Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people signed in Victoria
item.description: Leaders and activists say they are feeling the gravity of Australia's first treaty with Aboriginal people being signed and formalised as law.

item.title: Liberals want to ditch net zero but IEA report says it's cheaper and cleaner
item.description: The most authoritative snapshot of where the global energy transition is going has just been released at a most opportune moment for any politician weighing which direction Australia should pursue.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium goal at risk on eve of crucial AFL team vote
item.description: While Tasmania's MPs will pass the proposed AFL stadium through the lower house on Thursday, it's become a much tougher task ahead to win over the parliament's key upper house decision-makers.

item.title: Almost half a million households could be eligible for federal government's co-purchasing scheme
item.description: The Help to Buy scheme will open to applicants soon. However, new research finds almost half a million households could be eligible for just 10,000 places in the co-ownership scheme.

item.title: Regulator raises alarm over insecticide use on blueberries, suspends products
item.description: The federal pesticide authority has updated how the chemical dimethoate can be used on berries after new data confirmed skyrocketing consumption has been putting young children over the safety limit.

item.title: Prabowo Subianto's foreign policy hints at what Indonesia gains from treaty with Australia
item.description: Details of an upgraded security treaty between Indonesia and Australia are yet to be made public, and the practical impact it will have on relations between the two countries depends on who you ask.

item.title: Army veteran walking around Australia for charity reported to police over assistance dog
item.description: Despite assistance dog Max wearing a vest and Garth Murray carrying his accreditation, they still faced illegal discrimination on a round-Australia charity walk, with one publican even calling the police on them.

item.title: Australians suffering 'irreversible complications' waiting years to see medical specialists
item.description: Some Australians are waiting more than six years to see health specialists, prompting doctors to warn that people are risking death while languishing on public waiting lists.

item.title: Menulog is closing down in Australia later this month. Here's what we know
item.description: The food delivery company is set to shut down on November 26. Here's what we know about the closure.

item.title: Sri Lankan cricketers forced to stay in Pakistan despite Islamabad bombing
item.description: Sri Lanka's cricket board has told concerned players they must stay in Pakistan to complete a white-ball tour despite 12 people dying in a bombing in Islamabad earlier this week.

item.title: Photos: Aurora Australis puts on dazzling display
item.description: One of nature's most dazzling shows was on display last night. Take a look at some of the photos taken across southern Australia.

item.title: Federal politics: Liberals to dump net zero by 2050, shadow ministers decide — as it happened
item.description: A meeting of Liberal shadow ministers ends with a decision to dump the net zero by 2050 target, following a party room meeting yesterday.

item.title: Hawthorn faces another AFLW finals exit in straight-sets as they struggle to recapture 2024 magic
item.description: Despite finishing the home-and-away season in fourth spot on the ladder — earning the double chance — Hawthorn has struggled to recapture the magic of its rapid 2024 rise and faces another straight-sets exit out of finals.

item.title: Financial pinch leaves Winter Olympic hopefuls struggling to afford skis
item.description: A ski mountaineering athlete and trail runner by day and a DJ by night, Lara Hamilton scrapes for every dollar to finance her dream of becoming a Winter Olympian.

item.title: ASX tumbles, Aussie dollar jumps as stronger jobs figures quash rate cut prospects — as it happened
item.description: The local share market takes another leg lower as labour force figures pour cold water on rate cut expectations. Look back on the day's financial news and insights from our specialist business reporters.

item.title: Taiwan evacuates 8,300 ahead of tropical storm Fung-wong
item.description: Soldiers rescue people in neck-deep floodwaters as heavy rains lash Taiwan, where thousands have been evacuated ahead of tropical storm Fung-wong.

item.title: Two eight-year-old girls with nowhere to go highlight Kununurra's social issues
item.description: With young people in Kununurra making news for the wrong reasons over the last month, a police patrol shows the stark reality for children on the streets.

item.title: Missed last night's aurora australis? Here's when and where it's likely to put on a show tonight
item.description: The skies lit up overnight with a spectacular light show by the aurora australis. But as the two-year solar peak period ends, tonight may be your last chance to see the southern lights for a while.

item.title: PR campaign to relocate Melbourne sculpture to Mildura 'profoundly silly' says artist
item.description: The artist whose sculpture headlines a regional Victorian tourism campaign says it's a "beat up to get publicity".

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein mentioned Donald Trump in several newly released emails. This is what he said
item.description: Donald Trump's relationship with Jeffrey Epstein is pushed back into the spotlight after he was named in several years-old emails unearthed by a congressional committee investigation.

item.title: Gold Coast police officer's pull-up world record marred by online abuse
item.description: Jade Henderson says she has been the victim of online abuse since breaking the Guinness World Record for the most pull-ups in an hour.

item.title: Oscar Piastri set for test of 'character' as Formula 1 championship chase unravels
item.description: Oscar Piastri will have to show "character" after his recent F1 disappointments says his manager, former Australian ace Mark Webber.

item.title: More players involved in Shield, First Guardian collapses face ASIC legal action
item.description: Corporate watchdog ASIC is suing several players involved in the collapses of Shield and/or First Guardian, which led to Australians losing more than $1 billion of their retirement savings.

item.title: Hervey Bay community comes together to protect Torquay caravan park
item.description: Fraser Coast council is weighing whether to transform a popular tourism site into a public green space, prompting a backlash from thousands of locals.

item.title: Emails reveal former prince Andrew talked to Jeffrey Epstein long after claiming he cut contact
item.description: Newly released emails reveal former prince Andrew begged Jeffrey Epstein to ensure a strong denial of his involvement with alleged crimes was sent to a tabloid.

item.title: Country SA heavy metal band KNAW travels 800km for 40-minute gig
item.description: Heavy metal band KNAW dream of playing festivals one day. The problem is they are the only band of their kind around for hundreds of kilometres.

item.title: Australia's unemployment rate slips to 4.3 per cent
item.description: The unemployment rate fell to 4.3 per cent in October, down from 4.5 per cent in September, as the number of people in employment increased by 42,200.

item.title: Oscar Piastri says McLaren team orders in Monza part of 'perfect storm' for horror Azerbaijan Grand Prix
item.description: Oscar Piastri says the Azerbaijan Grand Prix weekend was the worst of his racing career and has hinted McLaren team orders may have played a part in it.

item.title: Teenager sentenced to 16 years behind bars for murder of grandmother Vyleen White at Ipswich shopping centre
item.description: The then-16-year-old stabbed the Queensland grandmother at a shopping centre in February last year as her granddaughter watched on.

item.title: Renowned lawyer returns to Wittenoom asbestos case that changed his life
item.description: Forty years ago, the Wittenoom asbestos disaster changed Peter Gordon's life. Now he has come back to finish what he started.

item.title: Trump signs bill to end longest government shutdown in US history
item.description: President Donald Trump has signed a bill ending the longest government shutdown in US history.

item.title: Neo-Nazi Thomas Sewell granted bail on charges relating to attack on Camp Sovereignty in Melbourne
item.description: Neo Nazi Thomas Sewell had been granted bail after a Supreme Court judge found he would not pose an unacceptable risk to the community.

item.title: Contact tracing underway in Queensland as health authorities brace for further measles cases
item.description: Health authorities expect to see more confirmed cases of measles in the next 48 hours as contact tracing into a Brisbane outbreak begins.

item.title: Hundreds of Qantas jobs to come to new innovation centre in Adelaide
item.description: The South Australian government has entered into an agreement with Qantas for a Product Innovation Centre that is expected to create more than 420 technology jobs by the end of 2028.

item.title: Documentary follows William Corlett's week-long 500km Blue Mountains run
item.description: A documentary following a young man's epic 500-kilometre run over seven days is nominated for awards at six international film festivals.

item.title: Australia's spring weather swings from hot to cold and back again in battle of the seasons
item.description: From heat, back to snow, fire danger and storm warnings — spring weather has given the country some serious whiplash. What's behind it?

item.title: Liberal Party formally abandons net zero by 2050 climate target
item.description: The decision brings the party closer to the Nationals, which ditched its support for the target earlier this month amid internal turmoil over the Coalition's policy.

item.title: Eliza West fell out of favour with Melbourne. Now she's leading Hawthorn in finals
item.description: Eliza West is leading the Hawks on a finals charge in the AFLW, but it comes after a 'disheartening' call at the Demons.

item.title: AC/DC concert shakes Melbourne all night long with low-level seismology recordings
item.description: Rock royalty AC/DC power up the earthshaking riffs at the MCG, rattling Melbourne with low-level seismic recordings.

item.title: How Fully Sikh author Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa's life was shaped by slam poetry
item.description: This year, Sukhjit Kaur Khalsa earned an Order of Australia medal and published her first book, Fully Sikh, all while running an indie theatre in Perth.

item.title: Rival and traditional Adelaide sporting clubs under threat by university merger
item.description: Sporting clubs from the University of Adelaide and UniSA face an uncertain future in an amalgamation process that has pitted some clubs against each other in the race to be a part of the new institute.

item.title: Vote on releasing Jeffrey Epstein files set to go ahead as US government shutdown ends
item.description: As the longest government shutdown in US history winds up, a fresh bout of political infighting is brewing over the Jeffrey Epstein files.

item.title: Mezzo-soprano Joyce DiDonato, advocate for opera for all, on her first Australian tour
item.description: Joyce DiDonato is one of opera's most in-demand mezzo-sopranos. She shares her passion for inclusivity and advocacy ahead of her first Australian tour.

item.title: Shelby Cobra among a dozen allegedly stolen vehicles found in central Victoria police raid
item.description: A $120,000 Shelby Cobra Roadster is found among a dozen allegedly stolen vehicles during a police raid in central Victoria.

item.title: Justis Huni leads tributes for trainer Keri Fui after fatal collapse in gym ahead of boxing return
item.description: Justis Huni leads tributes for long-time ally Keri Fui, who died from a heart attack while training the heavyweight boxer.

item.title: Police used unreasonable force in fatal shooting of Bradley Balzan, coroner finds
item.description: A coroner finds police used an unreasonable level of force during the fatal shooting of Sydney man Bradley Balzan, prompting sweeping recommendations to overhaul proactive policing practices in NSW.

item.title: Macquarie Point stadium order passes Tasmania's lower house with 'yes' vote
item.description: An order to build the Macquarie Point AFL stadium on Hobart's waterfront has passed the lower house after a lengthy six-hour debate, paving the way for a deciding vote in the upper house next month.

item.title: Jury in trial of Rajwinder Singh, charged with Toyah Cordingley's murder, shown photographs of boyfriend's hike on day of her death
item.description: Former Innisfail nurse Rajwinder Singh is charged with the 24-year-old's 2018 death in Far North Queensland. The jury has today been shown photos of her partner Marco Heidenreich's activities on the afternoon she died.

item.title: What we know about the ties between Donald Trump and Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Years-old emails from Jeffrey Epstein mentioning Donald Trump have been released, raising new questions about the extent of their relationship. Here's what we know about the ties between them.

item.title: Townsville mayoral candidate recruits lost tourist in exchange for lift to cruise ship
item.description: Joanne Keune maintains the tourist says it was the best thing that happened to him in Townsville.

item.title: Shay Mitchell's new skincare brand for children sparks controversy
item.description: A new skincare line for children by actress-turned-entrepreneur Shay Mitchell creates an online uproar, with many questioning the need for the products.

item.title: Manslaughter charges dropped against Queensland couple over death of three-year-old
item.description: Police drop manslaughter charges against a Queensland couple after the death of their toddler from a rare disease.

item.title: Bribie Island officially reconnected as workers close breakthrough
item.description: Operators pushing tonnes of sand across a breakthrough at Bribie Island have officially closed the gap.

item.title: Shire of Augusta-Margaret River doubles fines and looks at night restictions as part of illegal camping crackdown
item.description: A WA council has doubled fines for illegal camping and will look at locking people out of visitor hotspots at night, as it struggles to stop people staying in vans and tents at popular tourist spots.

item.title: South Australian woman wins four-year court battle over $104 parking fine
item.description: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

item.title: Ley's net zero decision may bring her extra time as leader, but at what cost?
item.description: Ley's decision may have brought her extra time as leader. The question will be at what cost.

item.title: Cameron Green misses out on Sheffield Shield century on Ashes eve
item.description: Test all-rounder Cameron Green is dismissed six runs shy of a drought-breaking Sheffield Shield century, while Victoria coach Chris Rogers thinks he may have found Usman Khawaja's successor.

item.title: Canberra man who leapt into into Lake Burley Griffin after high-speed chase denied bail
item.description: The 39-year-old will remain in custody after a judge rejected his request for bail to attend drug rehabilitation.

item.title: Unmasking the men who attended a Neo-Nazi protest outside NSW parliament
item.description: Around 60 men attended a protest at NSW parliament organised by the Neo-Nazi group National Socialist Network on Saturday. Without masks, it gave the ABC the opportunity to identify some of them.

item.title: Push to return 130GL of water to Murray-Darling Basin sparks backlash
item.description: More water rights in the Murray-Darling Basin will be purchased from farmers and irrigators in a renewed push by the federal government to return 450 gigalitres of water to the environment.

item.title: Jane Goodall farewelled in Washington, DC, Leonardo DiCaprio among mourners
item.description: The groundbreaking primatologist, who died in October, has been farewelled at a service in Washington, DC.

item.title: Growing evidence of secret taxpayer-funded boats for illegal foreign fishers
item.description: An Australian Border Force vessel has docked in Broome carrying four fishing boats, prompting anger from the fishing industry over a government scheme that gives illegal fishers boats to return home in.

item.title: West Australian man Patrick Hunter found guilty of child rape, indecent dealings
item.description: The 46-year-old committed offences against two children between 2019 and 2020, a Broome jury has found.

item.title: Thursday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Mark Wood suffers hamstring injury in England's pre-Ashes tour match
item.description: One of England's great bowling hopes for the summer cops a blow, as Mark Wood fails to finish the first day of a tour match.

item.title: Tasmanian salmon selectively bred to withstand warmer waters and bacterial disease
item.description: A salmon mass mortality event caused by a bacterial outbreak has given scientists "a lot of genetic knowledge" to put to use in a selective breeding program.

item.title: SA prison exec 'motivated by financial greed' in $300,000 prison upgrade rort, court hears
item.description: A South Australian court has heard that a correctional services executive was "motivated by financial greed" when he planned a $300,000 prison upgrade rort to fund his retirement.

item.title: Labor backbencher Dave Kelly hopes WA government's Dion Barber compensation appeal fails
item.description: A Labor MP says he hopes the state's appeal of a multi-million-dollar compensation payout to a child sexual abuse survivor fails, amid mounting criticism from legal experts and advocates.

item.title: Yipirinya School's future in doubt as enrolments plummet and debts mount
item.description: The future of an independent Indigenous school in Alice Springs is under a cloud after just 50 students turned up to class on Thursday, down from a peak enrolment of 360 in December last year.

item.title: National criminal history tracker to be established for working with children checks
item.description: Almost a decade after one was recommended by the Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse.

item.title: Gaming addiction treatment pioneer, botanist honoured at WA Australian of the Year awards
item.description: The psychiatrist who pioneered the country's first gaming disorder clinic at a public hospital has been named the 2026 Australian of the Year for WA.

item.title: Chinese police offer cash bounty for information that helps arrest Taiwanese influencers Wen Tzu-yu and Chen Po-yuan
item.description: The pair are accused of spreading "anti-China" content after releasing a documentary last year, which detailed Beijing's attempts at using influencers to court public support for unification.

item.title: France marks 10 years since Bataclan attacks in Paris with silence and ceremony
item.description: The attacks were the deadliest on French soil since World War Two, scarring the national psyche and prompting emergency security measures, many of which are now embedded in law.
